design_audit.running_variable_definition: Re-centered vote share (percent in favor minus 50)
design_audit.estimator_note: Cellini et al. (2010) QJE one-step dynamic RD estimator: areg outcome op_win_prev1-10 bond_win_prev1-10 + polynomial controls in vote share + year dummies | district FE, cluster(district_code). Focal parameter is average of op_win_prev1-10 coefficients (10-year average post-election effect).

claim_object.outcome_concept: Student academic outcomes (test score proficiency rates, dropout rate, postsecondary enrollment)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Passage of operational revenue limit referendum (school spending election)
claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect of referendum passage on student outcomes, averaged over 10 post-election years (dynamic RD local effect at 50% vote share cutoff)
claim_object.target_population: Wisconsin public school districts holding revenue limit referenda, 1996-97 through 2014-15

baseline_specs.label: Table5-PanelA-Col2
baseline_specs.n_controls_note: Many polynomial/lag controls; effective model has ~100+ regressors via wildcard expansion
baseline_specs.notes: Cubic polynomial in vote share; 10-year average operational referendum effect. Table 5 Panel A Col 2 (math proficiency grade 10) is the headline student outcome.

constraints.controls_note: The Cellini one-step estimator has a fixed structure of polynomial controls in vote share + year dummies + election characteristics. Control variation operates through polynomial order (linear/quadratic/cubic), not through add/drop of individual covariates.
constraints.linked_adjustment_note: Operational and bond referendum controls must vary together (both polynomial orders change jointly)

outcome_specific_weights.log_instate_enr: unweighted, but includes grade9lagged as additional control

constraints.outcome_specific_controls_note: log_instate_enr adds grade9lagged (lagged grade 9 enrollment) as an additional control beyond the standard Cellini polynomial set. All other outcomes use only the standard polynomial controls.

core_universe.design_spec_ids_note: Polynomial order variation is the primary within-design axis. Cubic is the baseline (Table 5 Panel A); linear and quadratic are Table 5 Panels C and B respectively. local_cubic omitted since it is the baseline.
core_universe.rc_spec_ids_note: Removed redundant specs: rc/controls/sets/{linear,quadratic,cubic}_polynomial duplicated the design/* polynomial variation; rc/weights/aw_num_takers is the baseline weight for test score outcomes; rc/data/focal_parameter/ten_year_avg is the baseline focal parameter; rc/sample/restrict/cross_section_{post,pre} duplicated rc/joint/cross_section_rd/*; rc/form/outcome/log_outcome removed because log_instate_enr is already logged and log-transforming proficiency rates (0-100%) is problematic.

canonical.notes: Clustered at district level, matching paper's cluster(district_code)

diagnostics_plan.notes: McCrary density test at 50% vote share cutoff (DCdensity.ado is included in package)
Table 3 in paper: tests for local balance between winning and losing districts on pre-election observables
